thread.title: Friday preview: US non-farm payrolls in focus amid interest rate speculation
thread.title_full: Friday preview: US non-farm payrolls in focus amid interest rate speculation

title: Friday preview: US non-farm payrolls in focus amid interest rate speculation
text:
967.50 -5.9999 
LONDON (ShareCast) - (ShareCast News) - The US non-farm payrolls report on Friday will give the Federal Reserve signs on whether the jobs market has picked up enough for an interest rate hike. Analysts expect the Labor Department's official month figures to show US employers added 225,000 jobs in July. The unemployment rate is forecast to remain at 5.3%. 
The Fed is closely monitoring the labour market and economic data in determining the timing of the first rate hike in nine years. 
Angus Campbell, senior analyst at FXPro Insights , said the non-farm payroll "non-farm payroll figure will be crucial in providing further evidence as to whether they'll move in September". 
It follows Wednesday's private payrolls report from ADP which showed an 185,000 increase in jobs in July, missing the forecast of 215,000. 
The initial jobless claims report on Thursday revealed a 3,000 rise to 270,000 in July in the week to 1 August, compared to estimates of 272,000.
